bibl.title: J.S. McGuire v Washington Territory. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the matter of the application of Habeas Corpus for J.S. Mcguide} In the Dist Court at Seattle King Co. W.T. Order.

Now comes Jas H. Lewis attorney for the applicant JSMc Yuire who upon oath deposes and says that the said JSMc Yuire is restrained illegally of his liberty by JHM Graw Sheriff in and that he desires to one out a suit of Habeas Corpus, that the said JSMc Yuire is a pauper, that he has no funds whereby to prosecute his said application, and most humbly prays that his honorable court to grant him an order allocating him the right to sue in forma prayer is in order to prosecute his court of Habeas Corpus- Jas H Lewis atty for JSmething Sworn to the this "June 1885 Heard Preston Notary Public

On reading the motion to see un forma pauperis of JSMc Yuire that he is illegally restrained of his liberty, & desires to prosecute & writ of Habeas Corpus and the Court being abaised grants said motion and permits said petitioner to sue in paper forma panperis. Greene G.
4446 FILED JUN 5 1885 James Searey, Clerk By James P Laudem Deputy Clerk.
